step_1_context.text: There are many students, much noise, and a few empty seats.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use quantifiers to show amount with countable and uncountable nouns.
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not use much with countable plural nouns in standard affirmative statements.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: There are much books on the desk.
There are many books on the desk.
There is many books on the desk.
There are a little books on the desk.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: There are many books on the desk.
step_3_interactive_exercises.explanation_for_failure: Books are countable plural, so use many.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: I have a few money left.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: I have a little money left.
step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: Money is uncountable; use little/a little.
